macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: FTSE 100 Ends Week at Record High of 10,446
items.summary: The FTSE 100 gained 43 points to close at 10,446, while the FTSE 250 rose 0.52% to 23,427.27, marking a positive end to the week amid strong UK market performance.

items.title: Gold Nears Record High Near $5,000 per Ounce After US Inflation Data
items.summary: Gold traded close to $5,000 per ounce and silver surged above $77 per ounce following fresh US inflation data release, reflecting safe-haven demand.

items.title: S&P 500 Faces Technical Weakness with Failed Breakouts
items.summary: The S&P 500's failed breakouts indicate a darkening technical outlook, amid VIX volatility and upcoming earnings from companies like Walmart and Alibaba.

items.title: Indian IT Stocks Plunge on AI Fears; Nifty 50 Down 1.3%
items.summary: Nifty 50 closed at 25,471, down 336 points or 1.3%, while Sensex fell over 1,000 points due to AI disruption fears and global uncertainty hitting IT sector.

items.title: US 10-Year Treasury Yield at 4.17% as of February 11 Close
items.summary: US 10-Year Treasury yield stood at 4.17% and 30-Year at 4.82% at official close on February 11, amid ongoing market sensitivity to rates.

items.title: Caterpillar Leads US Gainers with 4.40% Rise
items.summary: Caterpillar (CAT) topped gainers at 4.40% to $775, followed by Verizon (3.33%) and Coca-Cola (2.33%) as of February 11 data.

items.title: Pandora Shifts to Platinum Plating Amid Precious Metals Volatility
items.summary: Jewelry firm Pandora announced transition from silver to platinum due to unprecedented volatility in precious metal markets.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Reclaims $70,000 After February Sell-Off
items.summary: Bitcoin has rebounded above $70,000, trading at around $70,215 (up 2% in 24 hours) following a deep slide to near $60,000, driven by softer-than-expected CPI inflation data boosting rate cut expectations. The rally triggered the largest shorts liquidation event since 2024 and lifted crypto equities like Coinbase (up 18%) and MicroStrategy (up 10%).

items.title: Largest Bitcoin Shorts Liquidation Since 2024 Amid Price Rebound
items.summary: Bitcoin experienced its biggest shorts liquidation event since 2024 as the price recovered from recent lows near $60,000, catching short position builders off-guard after weeks of building bearish bets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Canada and Germany Sign AI Joint Declaration and Launch Sovereign Technology Alliance
items.summary: On February 14, 2026, ministers from Canada and Germany signed a Joint Declaration of Intent on AI during the Munich Security Conference, launching the Sovereign Technology Alliance to boost cooperation in secure compute infrastructure, AI research, commercialization, and talent development. The alliance aims to reduce strategic technology dependencies and foster sovereign AI capabilities among trusted partners.
items.source: Silicon Valleys Journal / Cision PR Newswire

items.title: India Plans Massive AI 'Data City' to Bridge Gap with US and China
items.summary: India is planning a vast 'data city' on a staggering scale to power digital growth and narrow the AI gap with leading nations like the US and China. The initiative supports India's push to accelerate AI infrastructure and capabilities.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Ubisoft Cancels Six Games Including Prince of Persia Remake in Major Business Reset
items.summary: French video game company Ubisoft has cancelled six upcoming titles as part of a major business restructuring, including the long-awaited Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake first announced in 2020. The announcement caused Ubisoft's stock to plummet 33% on January 22, 2026.

items.title: BCG Report Projects Global Gaming Revenue to Reach $353 Billion by 2030
items.summary: According to BCG's 2026 report, global video gaming revenue reached $263 billion in 2025, with projections of $353 billion by 2030 at a 6% compound annual growth rate. The report identifies cloud gaming growth and creator economy expansion as key industry trends.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: India Plans Massive 'Data City' for AI Infrastructure Growth
items.summary: India is developing a vast new data city to power digital growth and narrow the AI gap with the United States and China. The project in Visakhapatnam has secured $175 billion in investment agreements, including a $15 billion Google investment for its largest AI infrastructure hub outside the US.

items.title: African Union Launches 10-Year Digital and Green Economy Initiative
items.summary: The African Union unveiled a comprehensive 10-year implementation plan at its 39th Ordinary session to position the continent as a leader in the digital age. The initiative includes establishing national innovation centers across all 55 member states and launching the Africa Education, Science, Technology, and Innovation Fund.

items.title: 5th China Chaoshan International Textile and Garment Exhibition Announced
items.summary: The exhibition will take place March 18-20, 2026 in Shantou, featuring industry forums on supply chain innovation and partnerships with major e-commerce platforms including Douyin, TikTok, and Taobao.
